results.title: Fire vs fire
results.brief_description: A fire control training film, based on a conference held to discuss burning out and backfiring as techniques of controlling forest fires. The indirect attack is backfiring (backburning) toward the main fire from a distance. Burning out necessitates working in close and burning toward the fire.

results.title: Fire: two ways out
results.brief_description: Homes can burn very rapidly. Victims generally suffocate and become unconscious before the fire actually reaches them. It is important to know how to escape if a fire threatens your home. Two escape routes must be planned in advance in case one is blocked by flames.

results.title: Fire risks with underground conveyors
results.creator_credit: Grahame Tharp, Jack Chambers, Data Film Productions and National Coal Board
results.brief_description: Demonstrates how fires are caused on mine conveyor belts, how correct pit maintenance can prevent many of these outbreaks and how National Coal Board research is developing devices and materials to reduce these risks. Reference is made in the film to the use of polyvinyl chloride plastic for conveyor belts.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Grahame Tharp, Jack Chambers, Data Film Productions and National Coal Board

results.title: Fire: not in my house
results.brief_description: The aim of the film is to motivate the viewer to clean up fire hazards in their home. Home fires can be more immediately damaging than ecological pollution. Several people are spectators at a home fire; on their return home, they recognise fire hazards in their own environment, and quickly take steps to eliminate the possibility of fires in their homes.

results.title: Fire mountain
results.creator_credit: Bert Van Bork and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Dramatic close-up views of a volcano erupting and rare features associated with volcanic action. Filmed during the eruption of Kilauea, on the island of Hawaii in 1969, this was the second greatest eruption in Hawaii’s history, the fountain height exceeding 1800 feet. The lava cascade was more than twice the height of Niagara Falls.

results.title: Fire: friend or foe
results.brief_description: Various fire risks and precautions, and fire-fighting techniques. After indicating the immense cost to the community involved in fires, the film shows the work of the Survey Department of the Fire and Accident Underwriters’ Association, and the Commonwealth Expeprimental Building Station in reducing fire hazards. Two types of automatic alarm are shown in action and the work of the fire brigades is described.

results.title: A Fire called Jeremiah
results.creator_credit: James Algar and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: Shows modern technical methods of fire-fighting used by the United States Forest Service to prevent forest fires from approaching gigantic proportions and destroying hundreds of human lives.

results.title: Fips the trouble maker
results.brief_description: Puppet film for children and without commentary. Tells the story of the irrepressible trouble-maker Fips, a mischievous toy maker. He interrupts the elephant and bear and two dolls who are reading a story, knocks their toys over, and is sat in the corner, until one relents and lets him have a bowl whereupon he knocks down all the pins first go!
